cards.front: Responsible AI for healthcare data: Which two principles matter most?
back: Accountability + Privacy & Security.
Accountability: meet legal/ethical standards; assign human oversight.
Privacy & Security: protect PII/PHI, anonymize where possible, secure data at rest/in transit.
Not primary here: Fairness (treat users fairly), Inclusiveness (empower everyone).
Think “AP” like ‘Anonymize & Provenance’:
A = Accountability (humans answer for outcomes).
P = Privacy/Security (PHI protection first).

cards.front: Azure translation across text↔speech and multiple languages: which services?
back: Translator + Speech.
Translator: text↔text in many languages.
Speech: speech↔text and text→speech (can pair with Translator for speech translation).
Not for translation: Key phrase extraction, CLU, Language detection (helps detect, not translate).
Generative AI returns responses (natural language, images, code, etc.) from natural language input.
Contrast: ‘Deep learning’ is a technique; ‘Generative AI’ is a capability that produces new content.

cards.front: Predict probability of diabetes (yes/no) from age & body fat: which model?
back: Logistic regression (classification → probability 0–1).
Linear regression predicts continuous values, not classes.
Hierarchical clustering is unsupervised grouping, not probability classification.

cards.front: Extract main issues from support tickets and also find people/products mentioned. Which features?
back: Key Phrase Extraction + Named Entity Recognition (NER).
Key Phrases: main topics/issues.
NER: detects entities (people, organizations, products, locations, quantities).
Not for this: Bot Service, Speech, CLU (intent/slot for dialogs, not bulk mining).

cards.front: Azure AI Document Intelligence: scan international passports + sales accounts?
back: ID Document model (passports, driver’s licenses) + Invoice model (sales invoices/accounts).
Not ideal: Business card, Receipt, generic ‘Language’ models.

cards.front: Azure AI Face: one-to-many vs one-to-one identity checks—what to use?
back: Face Identification: one-to-many (match one face to a collection).
Face Verification: one-to-one (same person? yes/no).
Face attributes/find-similar do not establish identity.

cards.front: Why not choose ‘Inclusiveness’ as a top-2 principle for healthcare data designs?
back: Inclusiveness is important broadly, but protecting sensitive health data and ensuring accountability are the priority risks to mitigate for healthcare data management scenarios.

cards.front: Why isn’t ‘Language detection’ the right choice for multilingual translation tasks?
back: Language detection identifies the language; it doesn’t translate.
Use Translator for text↔text and combine Speech for speech↔text/text→speech.

cards.front: Logistic vs Linear Regression (quick rule of thumb):
back: Logistic: classification (probability of class membership).
Linear: continuous numeric prediction (e.g., price, temperature).
Passport/ID page → ID Document model.
Sales invoice/account docs → Invoice model.
Receipts → Receipt model; Business cards → Business Card model.
